content.user_title: Optimize AI prompts with evidence-based techniques
content.value_statement: Poorly structured prompts produce inconsistent AI responses. This skill applies a 5-phase framework using Chain-of-Thought, Self-Consistency, and other evidence-based patterns to transform prompts into high-performing versions with measurable improvement.
actual_capabilities: Detect and eliminate anti-patterns (vague instructions, missing context)
Apply evidence-based techniques (CoT, Self-Consistency, ReAct, Few-Shot)
Run A/B tests to measure improvement
Iteratively refine prompts based on validation results
Generate optimization reports with performance metrics
limitations: Requires claude-flow@alpha dependency for full integration
20-40 minutes needed for complete optimization cycle
Effectiveness may vary across different AI models
User must provide the initial prompt to optimize

prompt_templates.title: Quick Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this prompt for structure, clarity, and anti-patterns. List the 7 components present or missing: [INSERT PROMPT]

prompt_templates.title: Structure Template
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an optimized prompt using this template: System Context, Role Definition, Task Description, Constraints, Format Specification, Examples, Quality Criteria. Topic: [INSERT TOPIC]

prompt_templates.title: CoT Enhancement
prompt_templates.prompt: Add Chain-of-Thought reasoning to this prompt. Include step-by-step thinking structure with thinking tags: [INSERT PROMPT]

prompt_templates.title: Full Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the complete 5-phase Prompt Architect framework to optimize this prompt. Include anti-pattern detection, structure optimization, evidence-based techniques, A/B test design, and iterative refinement. Original prompt: [INSERT PROMPT]

output_examples.input: Please try to write a good summary of this article maybe include the main points if possible
output: Analysis: 7 components - Missing 5 (role, constraints, format, examples, quality criteria)
Anti-patterns detected: Vague instructions ('please', 'maybe'), missing context, no output format
Optimized version: Defined role as expert editor, added specific constraints, specified JSON output format, included 2 examples
Expected improvement: 35% score increase based on similar optimizations

best_practices: Always use the 7-component structure: System Context, Role, Task, Constraints, Format, Examples, Quality Criteria
Replace vague language with imperative commands: Use 'You must' instead of 'Please try to'
Include 2-3 concrete examples demonstrating expected input-output patterns
Define clear quality criteria with measurable success thresholds
anti_patterns: Using vague qualifiers: 'please', 'try to', 'maybe', 'possibly' - these weaken instructions
Missing system context: Failing to provide background information or domain knowledge
No output format specification: Allowing unstructured or inconsistent response formats
Conflicting instructions: Including requirements that contradict each other

faq.question: Which AI tools support these optimized prompts?
faq.answer: Optimized prompts work with Claude, GPT-4, Codex, and any LLM. Structure patterns are model-agnostic.

faq.question: What improvement should I expect?
faq.answer: Typical improvements range from 20-40% in score, 85-95% success rate, and 0.8-0.9 consistency.

faq.question: How does this integrate with SPARC workflows?
faq.answer: Use prompt-architect before SPARC phases to optimize specification prompts for better architecture outcomes.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill processes prompts locally in your workflow. No prompt data is sent to external services.

faq.question: What if my optimized prompt fails validation?
faq.answer: Phase 5 handles failures through iterative refinement. Analyze root causes, apply fixes, and re-validate.

faq.question: How is this different from basic prompt engineering?
faq.answer: This uses a systematic 5-phase framework with A/B testing. You get measurable improvements, not just best practice tips.
